mdRecord.dcterms:description: Peacefield was the home and farm of John Adams and his wife, Abigail Smith Adams. Later, it was also the home of John Quincy Adams, his wife Louisa Catherine Adams, their son Charles Francis Adams, and Charles' sons, historians Henry Adams and Brooks Adams. The oldest portion of the house was built in 1731 and acquired by John and Abigail Adams in 1787. The house at that time consisted of only two low-ceilinged rooms on the ground floor, two bedrooms, and an attic. [Between 1787 and 1800] Abigail Adams greatly expanded [the house], adding what is now the right side of the front facade, with a fine hallway and large parlor on the ground floor and a large study above. Adams returned to the house full-time in 1801. Further extensions to the house were made by his son, Charles Francis Adams. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peacefield [work]
